citation.article-title: Adhaeribacter aerophilus sp. nov., Adhaeribacter aerolatus sp. nov. and Segetibacter aerophilus sp. nov., isolated from air samples
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Adhaeribacter aerophilus sp. nov.
Adhaeribacter aerophilus (ae.ro.phi′lus. Gr. n. aer air; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. masc. adj. aerophilus air-loving).
Cells are strictly aerobic, Gram-stain-negative, non-motile, non-spore-forming rods that are 0.9–1.1 μm in diameter and 2.0–4.3 μm in length.
Colonies are smooth, circular, convex and pink after 3 days at 30 °C on R2A agar.
Grows on LB, CM3-nutrient agar and WA (very weakly), but not on NA, TSA or MacConkey agar.
Growth occurs at 10−37 °C, at pH 6.5–8.5 and with 0–1 % NaCl.
Does not hydrolyse casein, chitin, hypoxanthine, tyrosine or xanthine.

Positive (in API 20NE and API ZYM strips) for hydrolysis of aesculin and gelatin, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase and α-mannosidase, and negative for nitrate reduction, indole production, acid production from glucose, arginine dihydrolase, urease, β-galactosidase (substrate p-nitrophenyl β-d-galactopyranoside), lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase and α-fucosidase.
Does not assimilate any of the carbohydrates tested (API 20NE and API ID 32GN).

Positive for assimilation of the following substrates: amygdalin, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, d-glucose, glutaric acid, glycogen, itaconate, lactose, malonate, maltose, d-mannose, melezitose, melibiose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl β-d-xyloside, N-acetylglucosamine, oxalic acid, raffinose, l-rhamnose, salicin, sucrose, trehalose, turanose and d-xylose.

Negative for assimilation of the following substrates: acetate, adipate, d-adonitol, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, arbutin, citrate, dextran, dulcitol, erythritol, formate, d-fructose, d-fucose, l-fucose, gluconate, l-glutamic acid, glycerol, histidine, inositol, inulin, lactate, d-lyxose, malate, maleic acid, d-mannitol, phenylacetate, l-proline, propionate, pyruvic acid, d-ribose, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose, succinic acid, d-tagatose, tartaric acid, xylitol and l-xylose.
The predominant isoprenoid quinone is MK-7.
The major fatty acids are summed feature 4 (comprising iso-C17 : 1 I and/or anteiso-C17 : 1 B), iso-C15 : 0 and C16 : 1ω5c.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 44.5 mol%.
The type strain, 6424S-25T (=KACC 14118T =NBRC 106134T), was isolated from an air sample from Suwon, Republic of Korea.
